rev.comment: added info on PSU scandal investigation
rev.diff:
Line 164: Line 164:
In late May 2011, Freeh was retained as an independent investigator by the Ethics Committee of [[FIFA]] in the bribery scandal centering around [[Mohammed bin Hammam]] and [[Austin "Jack" Warner|Jack Warner]].<ref>[http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/international/8553478/Fifas-investigation-into-bribery-allegations-against-Mohamed-Bin-Hammam-and-Jack-Warner-takes-new-twist.html Telegraph: Bin Hammam/Warner Investigation expands] Paul Kelso, [[The Daily Telegraph]], 2 June 2011</ref>
In late May 2011, Freeh was retained as an independent investigator by the Ethics Committee of [[FIFA]] in the bribery scandal centering around [[Mohammed bin Hammam]] and [[Austin "Jack" Warner|Jack Warner]].<ref>[http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/international/8553478/Fifas-investigation-into-bribery-allegations-against-Mohamed-Bin-Hammam-and-Jack-Warner-takes-new-twist.html Telegraph: Bin Hammam/Warner Investigation expands] Paul Kelso, [[The Daily Telegraph]], 2 June 2011</ref>
  +   +
In November 2011, [[Pennsylvania State University]] announced that Freeh would lead an internal investigation into the [[child sexual abuse]] involving [[Jerry Sandusky]] and several high-ranking university officials.<ref>[http://live.psu.edu/story/56476 Former FBI director Freeh to conduct independent investigation] Penn State Live, 21 November 2011</ref>
